text:
Morning <!here>, very excited to announce the rename/rebrand of bflw to *betcode*!

This incorporates the new <https://github.com/betcode-org|GitHub organisation> with this slack and will open up the community to more users.

Currently betfairlightweight and flumine have been moved across (likely to involve updating any remotes if you pull the code) but hope to add more repo’s under our wing as well as inviting other members to become part of the org. Invite is open to anyone who has contributed or wants to contribute to the code :slightly_smiling_face:

Big thanks to the betconnect team (<@U02KNTX2Z7X> and <@U02HPTBLCJY>) for sponsoring the logo and brand :sunglasses:

text: So you have sold out to betconnect then, :joy:

elements.text: So you have sold out to betconnect then,

text:
Nope, a company has seen the value in a community like this and want to get more involved by sponsoring meetups, development and providing support. Why would we say no?

The rename/brand has been in the pipeline for a few years, I just needed a kick.

text:
Hi all, as some of you will already know, <@U4H19D1D2> has been working on integrating BetConnect via Flumine, which is coming in this PR <https://github.com/betcode-org/flumine/pull/560> building on initial work by <@U9JHLMZB4> and <@ULDAVFDRP>.

In readiness for this we’re now looking to talk to people who bet in pre race Horse Racing and pre match Football, as that is where we have our largest amounts of liquidity currently.

To kick things off we are hosting an event in London on the 31st March which we’d also like to invite those above to, to briefly present our commercial offering and USPs, and where our roadmap plans take us to, and how that benefits your P&L :slightly_smiling_face:

Feel free to message me directly if you have any questions or would like to sign up for the event :thumbsup:

Feel free to message me directly if you have any questions or would like to sign up for the event

text: I'd be very interested in this. I placed wagers programmatically with BC and despite the claim of large liquidity the fill rate of bets was supremely low. But, that was then and I'm excited to see what you have as I'm a big fan of the Betconnect concept, so hope it's a big success. Sign me up.

text: Whats the idea behind betconnect? I see it offers bookmaker prices, but also claims to be an exchange and seemingly bets need to be filled, which would support that. Right now that sounds like taking the bad aspects from both worlds (bad odds from bookmakers combined with lower liquidity from exchanges). Is there some page that helps me understand it better? The "How it works"/FAQ on the website didnt help me much.

elements.text: Whats the idea behind betconnect? I see it offers bookmaker prices, but also claims to be an exchange and seemingly bets need to be filled, which would support that. Right now that sounds like taking the bad aspects from both worlds (bad odds from bookmakers combined with lower liquidity from exchanges). Is there some page that helps me understand it better? The "How it works"/FAQ on the website didnt help me much.

text: Bookmaker odds are only “bad” from one side

elements.text: Bookmaker odds are only “bad” from one side

text: indeed, so i can also lay at bookmaker odds? Sounds like an exchange but with forced odds equalling the best bookie odds?

elements.text: indeed, so i can also lay at bookmaker odds? Sounds like an exchange but with forced odds equalling the best bookie odds?

text: You can see and back at the best bookmaker's odds from one place. No restrictions on stake size or gubbing of winners. Commissions on stake rather than winners (good for those who have an edge). Ability to match lays at bookmaker odds with no commission.

elements.text: You can see and back at the best bookmaker's odds from one place. No restrictions on stake size or gubbing of winners. Commissions on stake rather than winners (good for those who have an edge). Ability to match lays at bookmaker odds with no commission.

text: Bets are initiated by backers. So you can only lay if somebody is already backing, but then do so at the bookmaker's odds.

elements.text: Bets are initiated by backers. So you can only lay if somebody is already backing, but then do so at the bookmaker's odds.

text: I see. Is commission for backers and for layers?

elements.text: I see. Is commission for backers and for layers?

text:
The concept was predicated on the idea that sharps would send their bets in to be executed by those who still had bookmaker accounts and could bet themselves on top of the stake that was requested.

Some of you might have used Bet Butler. Similar thing here.

However, it's progressed from that initial concept, but still remains a place where sharps can send orders in to be filled.

The issue is liquidity. I've not found sufficient "layers" there for Horse Racing. Full disclosure, I was playing at "top prices" so there's less appetite even from "squares", but there in lay the fundamental issue with Betconnect. Why wouldn't someone bet on BF?
